intro: Viburnum jucundum var. detractum, commonly known as the dwarf arrowwood, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It features small, white, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by red berries in the fall. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that turn yellow in autumn, adding ornamental value. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and thrives in partial to full shade. Viburnum jucundum var. detractum is often used in landscaping for its compact size and seasonal interest.
